sentences.english: Japan were acquiescing in being strangled.
sentences.chinese: 日本默然同意别人把它捏死。

sentences.english: When Sakka had said this verse, the devas applauded but the asuras were silent.
sentences.chinese: 天帝释唱此偈时，诸天欢呼，阿修罗默然。

sentences.english: Say nought of have been staring at her quietly two young masters of language was not.
sentences.chinese: 更不用说一直盯着她默然不语的二少爷了。
接下来第二步则是连结默然。

sentences.english: A good example is like a bell that calls many to church.
sentences.chinese: 好例子就像教堂的钟声一样让人默然遵循。

sentences.english: If feared in the modern is silently everyone.
sentences.chinese: 如果在现代怕是大家都默然了吧。

sentences.english: Read it silently count melancholy, go into hurt.
sentences.chinese: 吟念清词细数惆怅，默然离去成伤。

sentences.english: I only could fall silent, keep the sad and hateful entanglement on paper.
sentences.chinese: 我只能默然，把这痛与恨的纠缠留在笔端。

sentences.english: In silence I turn, heard, a sigh.
sentences.chinese: 我默然转身，听到了，微微的叹息声。

definition: half of the day/a long time/quite a while
half the day/a long time/quite a while
to have a smile on one's face
to remain silent/to have nothing to say
to ponder/to reckon/to turn sth over in one's mind
